pull_request.title: Show 'Creator' instead of 'Admin' for the global user role picker
pull_request.body: ## Description - `Account Admin` users now display as `Creator` - Minor change to ensure that the option was also disabled Addresses: - https://linear.app/budibase/issue/BUDI-7550/update-the-labels-in-the-user-panel-ui-to-be-more-clear-around-the ## Screenshots ## Feature branch env [Feature Branch Link](http://fb-feature-change-global-admin-to-creator.fb.qa.budibase.net)

pull_request.title: Remove APIDoc comments.
pull_request.body:
## Description

We're planning to favour an OpenAPI schema approach in future and nobody really relies on these APIDoc comments today.

comment.body: We don't massively need it - but other documents have this `type` - like `row`, where it is quite important for the internal DB. I'd like to keep this consistent at least - I hadn't realised it was as inconsistent as it was.

pull_request.title: Make sourceId property of table required (for all table types)
pull_request.body:
## Description
We have been facing an issue with the user table where the `sourceId` is not always returned with the table, today the backend treats the source ID is required for external tables, but not required for internal tables. Some internal tables will have a `sourceId` of `bb_internal` - but this was not strictly required.

The frontend expects this to be available for every table and has created issues with it being missing. There are a few key changes in this PR which make sure the backend keeps the `sourceId` consistent.

1. The `ExternalTable` type has been removed, and the `sourceId` property of the `Table` has been made required. This required updating a fair number of tests that used the type, but I believe it is correct to represent a table as it should be in this way.
2. After this update there were some small code changes needed to handle this type, the main one was making sure that the base user table schema always includes the `sourceId`.
3. Another small change was needed to the old view API, there was a scenario where if it was unable to fetch a matching table for the view, it returned a mal-formed version of a table, this would have likely lead to weird things happening, so instead just throwing an error if this scenario occurs.

pull_request.title: Make the formblock description field visible in view mode.
pull_request.body:
## Description

Fix to ensure that the newly added description field is visible in `view` mode. 

The description text was previously inside the header block, but this gets hidden if the block doesn't have at least a `title` configured.

Original PR
- https://github.com/Budibase/budibase/pull/12101

commits.message:
License Key - Activate & Manage Tests

There are two test files, license.activate.spec.ts and license.manage.spec.ts

These test files each contain a test:
- Creates, activates, and deletes an online license for a self hosted account - license.activate.spec.ts
- Retrieves plans, creates checkout session, and updates license - license.manage.spec.ts

Updated and created API files
- StripeAPI
- LicenseAPI
- internal-api LicenseAPI
- index & AccountInternalAPI also updated to reflect API file changes
lint

Update license activate test

I have removed the end of the test which was to 'Verify user downgraded to free license'
- This is not needed

I have also updated getLicenseKey - specifically how it handles the expected 200 response
Add basic inline searching and fix create first row popup
Add inline searching for formula and longform columns, and improve searching operators where possible
Improve options inline searching
Merge branch 'develop' of github.com:Budibase/budibase into grid-inline-searching
Merge branch 'grid-all-datasources' of github.com:Budibase/budibase into grid-inline-searching
Fix text colour for inline searching in grid block
Fix issue with multiple filters at the same time and remove unused variable
Refactor to use types for fields and add support for searching bigint columns
Fix bug in SortableFieldSelect which results in options being available for sort fields
Refactor inline searching to be a separate concept from normal filters, and optimise API usage across all datasources
Ensure header cells properly update when reordered while a search value is applied
Merge branch 'grid-all-datasources' of github.com:Budibase/budibase into grid-inline-searching
Ensure keyboard events while inline searching are not captured by the main grid keyboard manager
Improve grid sorting labels to account for date types and provide better labels
Merge branch 'master' into account-portal-api-license-key
Merge branch 'grid-all-datasources' of github.com:Budibase/budibase into grid-inline-searching
Fix alert when duplicate auto columns exist

pull_request.title: Make sourceId property of table required (for all table types)
pull_request.body:
## Description
We have been facing an issue with the user table where the `sourceId` is not always returned with the table, today the backend treats the source ID is required for external tables, but not required for internal tables. Some internal tables will have a `sourceId` of `bb_internal` - but this was not strictly required.

The frontend expects this to be available for every table and has created issues with it being missing. There are a few key changes in this PR which make sure the backend keeps the `sourceId` consistent.

1. The `ExternalTable` type has been removed, and the `sourceId` property of the `Table` has been made required. This required updating a fair number of tests that used the type, but I believe it is correct to represent a table as it should be in this way.
2. After this update there were some small code changes needed to handle this type, the main one was making sure that the base user table schema always includes the `sourceId`.
3. Another small change was needed to the old view API, there was a scenario where if it was unable to fetch a matching table for the view, it returned a mal-formed version of a table, this would have likely lead to weird things happening, so instead just throwing an error if this scenario occurs.

comment.body:
This will be handled as part of enrichment of the tables when they are retrieved from the API/saved. Essentially we'll be migrating in place.

I've tested this - we already depended on enrichment for `internal/external` type value - so its not much different what we're doing now, just more consistent.

comment.body: No - I've updated the frontend to no longer use the `type` and the backend doesn't really use it either - they all depend on the `sourceType` instead now. Old apps will have this added onto them as part of enrichment.

comment.body: it really shouldn't there - this wasn't typed previously and the `fieldName` only pertains to relationships. Won't cause any problems - but no need for it to be there.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,27 +10,34 @@ import { events } from "@budibase/backend-core"
 import {
   BulkImportRequest,
   BulkImportResponse,
+  DocumentType,
   FetchTablesResponse,
   MigrateRequest,
   MigrateResponse,
+  Row,
   SaveTableRequest,
   SaveTableResponse,
   Table,
   TableResponse,
+  TableSourceType,
   UserCtx,
-  Row,
+  SEPARATOR,
 } from "@budibase/types"
 import sdk from "../../../sdk"
 import { jsonFromCsvString } from "../../../utilities/csv"
 import { builderSocket } from "../../../websockets"
 import { cloneDeep, isEqual } from "lodash"
-import { processInternalTable } from "../../../sdk/app/tables/getters"
 
 function pickApi({ tableId, table }: { tableId?: string; table?: Table }) {
   if (table && !tableId) {
     tableId = table._id
   }
-  if (table && table.type === "external") {
+  if (
+    table?.sourceId &&
+    table.sourceId.includes(DocumentType.DATASOURCE + SEPARATOR)
comment.body:
It would be better if we use helpers for this, so we can centralise and test this logic:
`dbUtils.isExternalTable(...)` or similar

pull_request.title: Make sourceId property of table required (for all table types)
pull_request.body:
## Description
We have been facing an issue with the user table where the `sourceId` is not always returned with the table, today the backend treats the source ID is required for external tables, but not required for internal tables. Some internal tables will have a `sourceId` of `bb_internal` - but this was not strictly required.

The frontend expects this to be available for every table and has created issues with it being missing. There are a few key changes in this PR which make sure the backend keeps the `sourceId` consistent.

1. The `ExternalTable` type has been removed, and the `sourceId` property of the `Table` has been made required. This required updating a fair number of tests that used the type, but I believe it is correct to represent a table as it should be in this way.
2. After this update there were some small code changes needed to handle this type, the main one was making sure that the base user table schema always includes the `sourceId`.
3. Another small change was needed to the old view API, there was a scenario where if it was unable to fetch a matching table for the view, it returned a mal-formed version of a table, this would have likely lead to weird things happening, so instead just throwing an error if this scenario occurs.

repo.name: budibase
repo.description: Low code platform for creating internal tools, workflows, and admin panels in minutes. Supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, MSSQL, MongoDB, Rest API, Docker, K8s, and more 🚀. Budibase, the low code platform you'll enjoy using ⚡

comment.body: Will this cause any conflict with the existing apps?
